question:
Many doctors recommend that older people exercise regularly, but most patients do not follow an exercise routine.
Why do you think this happens?
How can people be encouraged to exercise regularly?
text: Most of medical recomendations for elderly persons propose daily physical activity, but only a few percent follow these guides. I think, that with ageing there is also appear some difficulties in developing motivation for coming out from own comfort zone. So, let’s try to find out encouraging ways for increasing ratio of active participants.

Firstly, to do recommended exercises it’s required to win against all internal laziness and muscles inertion externally. But as it’s well known, once the first step on this path of muscles training is done then it will be more easy to repeat success. Also, sometimes older people just do not believe that any exercises could help them to feel better. This, for sure, raise a barrier in practice routine and affect motivation but could be solved with some inspirational influence. Basically, to believe in result and start doing exercise, it usually needs a small illustration or example. Thus, we can conclude on the base of this analysis that self-motivation usually is not strong enough for most of people and some external encourage required.

Thereby, it will be more productive to organise groups to motivate each other or even dedicate personal trainer. But alternatively and with less resources it is possible to use virtual trainers like subscriptionable bots, as a separate program in mobile devices or additional service inside social networks. More than that, combining electronic trainers with training groups could lead to sharing achievements and results via some kind of leaderboards and provide multiplied involvement effect.

Summarising, I can state that recommendations from doctors may be somehow attractive but it’s not mandatory so could be ignored by a lot of reasons. This way, to make recommended physical activity inspirational, there should be an external motivator added with examples, graphs, triggering events and social element.

error_list.error_des: It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The phrase Most of medical recomendations may require the use of the article the. Consider inserting the before the noun in your sentence.
If you do not want recomendations to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
The noun phrase daily physical activity seems to be missing a determiner before it. Consider adding an article.
The spelling of percent is a non-British variant. For consistency, consider replacing it with the British English spelling.
It seems that there is an article usage problem here.
You have used the compound adjective more easy. Consider using the comparative form of this adjective.
It seems that exercises may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The plural verb raise does not appear to agree with the singular subject This. Consider changing the verb form for subject-verb agreement.
It seems that result may not agree in number with other words in this phrase.
The word base doesn’t seem to fit this context. Consider replacing it with a different one.
It seems that preposition use may be incorrect here.
The phrase most of people may require the use of the article the. Consider inserting the before the noun in your sentence.
It appears that the quantifier less does not fit with the countable noun resources. Consider changing the quantifier or the noun.
If you do not want subscriptionable to be marked as misspelled in the future, you can add it to your personal dictionary.
